etymology.description: Simplified from 絲 via variant 𢇁; traditional 絲 is ideogrammic compound (會意): 糸 + 糸.
etymology.interpretation: Traditional 絲 combines two ‘silk/thread’ elements (糸 + 糸) to depict many fine strands, conveying the idea of silk or thread. The simplified form 丝 streamlines this by adopting the cursive/variant shape 𢇁, compressing the two threads into a single, more abstract looped form while preserving the original meaning.
etymology.simplification: Adopted a long-used handwritten/variant form (𢇁) that merges the double 糸 into one compact shape, greatly reducing strokes and improving writing speed for a very common word.

examples.chinese: 这条丝带很亮(這條絲帶很亮)。
examples.english: This silk ribbon is very bright.

examples.chinese: 他用丝线缝衣服(他用絲線縫衣服)。
examples.english: He sews clothes with silk thread.

examples.chinese: 丝绸之路连接东西方(絲綢之路連接東西方)。
examples.pinyin: Sīchóu zhī Lù liánjiē dōng xīfāng.
examples.english: The Silk Road connects East and West.
